item.title: Evelus Development Team
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“lemme_winks_, post:5, topic:429489”]i am sorry if i chose the wrong application for what i am applying for. this one came off friendly to me.

Name:
john

What is your most proudest moment when developing RSPS in either emulation or client hacking?
i don’t remember really

Are you knowledgeable in Java and SQL?
I have used SQL before. I am nowhere near knowledgeable enough to do anything fancy on the spot. SQL is fairly simple, and if it is required that I be familiar with it, I’d better start reading.

C++/C/Java/Lua/x86 ASM/Lisp (elisp & clisp)/C#/PHP - all packed in a 5 year hobby.

Rate yourself honestly?
I am a very safe and elegant programmer (probably why C is my favorite language :D). If I think something can be better, I will hate myself, then optimize (the Java programmer in me). I always plan before I start c0ding (<- the assembler getting in my head). I am neat in the editor–pun intended (explains the lisp in me).

What sets you apart from the other applicants?
i am the first applicant

Strengths?
low-level stuff. dealing with numbers (not implying low-level programming is generally dealing with numbers).

Weaknesses?
back-end stuff

Where can I contact you? My email: funny_hippo_@live.com My skype: (hold that thought)

i don’t have a lot of projects that i’m currently working on. my engine is a large side-project, but that shouldn’t affect how much i can code for you.[/quote]

I should have specified to say if it is your MSN/Skype address. I added you on MSN with your specified email but if it isn’t then just let me know. Nice application by the way. We can talk whenever you are available.

Read full topic

What is your most proudest moment when developing RSPS in either emulation or client hacking?
i don’t remember really

Are you knowledgeable in Java and SQL?
I have used SQL before. I am nowhere near knowledgeable enough to do anything fancy on the spot. SQL is fairly simple, and if it is required that I be familiar with it, I’d better start reading.

C++/C/Java/Lua/x86 ASM/Lisp (elisp & clisp)/C#/PHP - all packed in a 5 year hobby.

Rate yourself honestly?
I am a very safe and elegant programmer (probably why C is my favorite language :D). If I think something can be better, I will hate myself, then optimize (the Java programmer in me). I always plan before I start c0ding (<- the assembler getting in my head). I am neat in the editor–pun intended (explains the lisp in me).

What sets you apart from the other applicants?
i am the first applicant

low-level stuff. dealing with numbers (not implying low-level programming is generally dealing with numbers).

Where can I contact you? My email: funny_hippo_@live.com My skype: funny_hippo_

i don’t have a lot of projects that i’m currently working on. my engine is a large side-project, but that shouldn’t affect how much i can code for you.

item.title: Evelus Development Team
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:429489”]I would like to help in anyway I can, but most of my work client-side isn’t to increase understanding, but rather change the inner mechanics. (ie. changing the interface system, making it more flexible, etc)

But I do support your cause. Perhaps there would be less repetition in the community if people didn’t need to reinvent the wheel.[/quote]

I’m not looking for people who are advanced in client hacking but rather people who are willing to learn and show promise to be good team members who have fun. If you are interested then apply! I’m not going to say no because I don’t like you. I’m sure we can talk it out and then if there are any gaps I think that we can cross then we will get there when we get there.

I agree. Some of what we do is original and I don’t care if our ideas are released because I doubt anyone will copy them. Like I said we are people for the community and all our projects are community oriented. So I hope that helps dispel any confusion/worries.

Understanding the components and pieces of the client can come with me giving you a little lecture about what I know. Most of the ‘client hacking’ I see around here is as you said more practical application when we work with the understanding and inferring bit. So that’s something to be aware of. But its not difficult to learn. Like I said, I can help with that.

Read full topic

item.title: Evelus Development Team
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I would like to help in anyway I can, but most of my work client-side isn’t to increase understanding, but rather change the inner mechanics. (ie. changing the interface system, making it more flexible, etc)

But I do support your cause. Perhaps there would be less repetition in the community if people didn’t need to reinvent the wheel.
